thread.title: Prep football: Pine View ends skid vs. spiraling Murray
thread.title_full: Prep football: Pine View ends skid vs. spiraling Murray | The Salt Lake Tribune

title: Prep football: Pine View ends skid vs. spiraling Murray
text:
Murray â€¢ In perhaps what can best be described as a "Get Well Game," Pine View made the drive from Southern Utah worth every mile traveled.
The Panthers used a balanced offensive attack and a hard-hitting defense to earn a grind-it-out 20-10 non-region victory against Murray on Friday.
The victory ended a three-game losing streak for Pine View (5-3) and sent the Spartans (5-4) to their third straight defeat.
"It makes our confidence boost up a lot," Pine View senior quarterback Riley Livingston said. "We played with heart and now we see the bright side after three straight losses."
Livingston shook off a pair of second-quarter interceptions and threw for 206 yards and two touchdowns. Livingston's performance, combined with 119 yards from running back Kobe Topalian, was just what the doctor ordered for a team that lost twice by one score in the past three weeks.
  Livingston connected with Michael Moten for a 14-yard score and a 10-7 lead in the second quarter, then found Steve Bangerter on a pretty post pattern for a 35-yard touchdown in the third quarter.
Pine View's defense forced two turnovers and sacked Gage Cuthbertson three times. Cuthbertson weaved his way for a 27-yard touchdown run in the first quarter, but missed three of the Spartans' final four possessions with a right calf injury.
"We're a young team," Pine View coach Ray Hosner said. "We've got to get better and gotta keep working. Our defense played great."
Pine View linebacker Kyle Tauiliili made a big stop inside the 5-yard line that eventually held Murray to a field goal midway through the fourth quarter, then another big hit forced a fumble that effectively ended the Spartans' night.
Murray already has clinched a tie for a playoff spot, but can guarantee a Region 4 berth with a win in its finale next week at Hillcrest.
Pine View's postseason fate is a bit more precarious. The Panthers need a win at first-place Dixie.
